If you want to fetch GitHub private repositories via go get, you're in the right place.

Generate a ssh key

First, you'll need to create an ssh key. GitHub explains this very well here.

Add a deploy key to the private repository

Now, add the public key as an deploy key to the private GitHub repository. This is described here.

Tell go get to use ssh for your private repository

Simply execute the following (replace <user> and <repo> with your parameters.)

$ git config --global url."git@github.com:<user>/<private-repo>".insteadOf "https://github.com/<user>/<private-repo>"

You should now be able to run go get:

$ go get github.com/<user>/<private-repo>
